title: Writing out Quadratic Formula
text: The quadratic formula is given by (-b~sqrt(b**2+4ac)/2a.

title: Identify Coefficients
text: The values of a, $$b$$, and c correspond with the coefficients of the equation $$x^2+x+2=0$$. The standard form of a quadratic is $${ax}^2+bx+c$$.

title: Value of Coefficients
text: What is the value of a? Find the coefficient of the $$x^2$$ term.

title: Substitute Values
text: To calculate the value of $$x$$, plug in the values of a, $$b$$, and c and solve. The smaller of the two solutions uses the negative for the ~in front of the square root.
